feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: No Withholding Tax Line items is appearing in FB60 & MIRO after simulation or Posting
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We are currently configuring Withholding Tax (WHT) for an Indian company code in our S/4HANA 2023 system. All necessary configurations related to WHT have been completed, and we have verified and sure that the setup is correct from WHT Configuration perspective.

However, we are encountering the following issues:

  1. No WHT Line Item in FB60/MIRO:
    When simulating or posting vendor invoices through FB60 or MIRO, the withholding tax line item is not being generated. Additionally, the withholding tax amount is not displayed in the WHT tab even after simulating or posting. WHT in FSV and Posting keys are already setup optional.

  2. Missing "Vendor Country-Specific Enhancements" Tab:
    We observed that the "Vendor Country-Specific Enhancements" tab is missing in both the General Data and Company Code views of the Business Partner master data. This seems unusual and may be related to our issue. 

  3. BAdI MRM_WT_SPLIT_UPDATE Deactivated:
    We confirmed that the BAdI MRM_WT_SPLIT_UPDATE is currently deactivated in the system. So no issue with this BAdi now.

Given we are working on an initial WHT implementation in the 2023 version, are there any SAP Notes or version-specific steps we should consider? We're particularly concerned about the absence of the country-specific fields and whether any relevant BP role or data model enhancements are required for India localization.

#Withholding Tax #Business Partner #India company code

entry.title: Sales order with error message V1427 could not be repaired with report Z_V1427
entry.content:
Hello,

We have a sales order: 8324688 with inconsistency resulting in error message V1427, Item does not match schedule line (program error).

We have tried to repair the sales order using the repair program Z_V1427. We can see the program asks for a development key in our productive environment?

I can see in the tables VBAP and VBEP, that there's an item 140 in VBEP, which does not exist in VBAP.

Best regards

Lars B

entry.title: Issue with Override of Complete Delivery Flag in Sales Order Simulation API
entry.content:
Issue Summary

When using the Sales Order Simulation API (API_SALES_ORDER_SIMULATION_SRV) the parameter `CompleteDeliveryIsDefined = false` does not override the customer master setting for Complete Delivery. The system continues to enforce the Complete Delivery flag from master data, preventing partial confirmations, unlike the behavior in VA01.

Business Impact

The Commerce Cloud integration relies on the Sales Order Simulation API to provide accurate ATP results. Due to this issue, customers flagged for “Complete Delivery” in master data cannot receive partial confirmation results through API simulation, even though the payload contains  the needed ‘false’ flag. This results in inconsistent behavior between API-based processing and direct SAP GUI order creation, impacting order confirmation accuracy and eCommerce customer experience.

Question:
In VA01, when creating a Sales Order manually and removing the Complete Delivery flag, ATP check works correctly and allows partial confirmations. When Commerce Cloud sends payload to S/4 with "CompleteDeliveryIsDefined: false’ aiming to remove the complete delivery flag (like VA01), S/4 is not respecting this override and not allowing ATP to return partial confirmations.

  1. Why is this behavior different between direct GUI order creation and API-based order simulation, even when both aim to turn off the complete delivery requirement?
    2. Is there any SAP Note, configuration setting, development options, or workaround available to enable the simulation logic in S/4 to respect this flag ("CompleteDeliveryIsDefined: false’ ) and override the master data during order simulation via API?

entry.title: To be able send notifications to My Inbox App along with outlook
entry.content:
We are using flexible workflow for PR and PO. Currently, we have email notifications configured for notifying approvers that they have work items in their inbox, deadline notifications sent after 48 hours, approval of PR/PO sent to creator, rejection of PR/PO sent to creator. All these are configured with help of standard email templates available in Maintain Email Templates Application in Fiori.

However, we also have a requirement to be able to send the notifications to My Inbox of approvers or PO/PR creators. Is there a standard way of doing that?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

entry.title: Auto SES for Multiple PO Line items
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

Could someone help if there is any customization we can do in SAP S/4 Private cloud to enable or Automate Service Entry Sheet for multiple PO line items? Has anyone ever done this? I am aware there are multiple threads in this forum explaining about having one PO line and maintaining different service lines, but our business requirement is to have multiple PO line items, and each line item may have one or more services lines.

Any guidance on the program level changes if anyone has ever done would be very much appreciated. We are looking a way to automate the SES, may be a custom program by providing the Service PO number and the program can generate service entry sheets automatically based on the PO line items and the respective services lines in it.

Thanks,

Velu

SAP S/4HANA

entry.title: DMO Migration with system move option/Serial/ SUM 2.0 SP23 (PL5)
entry.content:
DMO Stuck – Waiting for OPT_CLONING.FLAG File

We are currently performing a DMO from ECC to S/4HANA. On the target system, SUM has been stuck since this morning in the phase:

Current Phase:
MAIN_SWITCH/SUBMOD_MIG_SWITCH_NEW/SUBMOD_MIG_SER_DOWNTIME_IMP/EU_CLONE_MIG_DT_IMP

with the message:

"Waiting for flag file 'OPT_CLONING.FLAG' in directory '/dump/SUM/abap/load/migrate_dt'"

However, the file OPT_CLONING.FLAG does not exist in that folder.

Do you have any idea how to proceed?

entry.title: CAP (Node.js) OData V2 Batch Request using SAP Cloud SDK – How to capture all errors in a changeset?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m working on a use case where I need to send a batch of update/create/delete requests from a SAP CAP (Node.js) backend to an SAP S/4HANA system. I'm using the SAP Cloud SDK and the Business Accelerator Hub to build and send the OData V2 (using odata-v2-adapter) batch requests.

Here’s what I’ve achieved so far:

  • I’m able to send multiple requests (update/create/delete) within a single batch.
  • To ensure transactional behavior, I wrap all these requests into one changeset.
  • This works well from a transactional standpoint: if any request fails, nothing is committed in S/4.

However, here’s the problem, when one request inside the changeset fails, only a single error is returned, and the rest of the requests are not processed. This behavior is expected according to OData V2 specs and SAP Cloud SDK documentation:

  • “The body of a ChangeSet response is either a response for all the successfully processed change request within the ChangeSet [...] or a single response indicating a failure of the entire ChangeSet.” (OData V2)
  • “If the execution of any request within a changeset fails, the whole changeset will be reflected as an error in the response.” (SAP Cloud SDK)

What I tried:

  • Splitting requests into multiple changesets (one per request) within the same batch allows me to retrieve individual errors, but I lose transactional integrity, some changes are committed while others fail.
  • I also explored the continueOnError option from the odata-v2-adapter, but it only applies between multiple changesets, not within a single changeset. So, again, it doesn’t help with my use case. (SAP Community Q&A)

What I’m looking for:

  • Is there any way (official or workaround) to get detailed errors for all requests without sacrificing atomicity?
  • Alternatively, is there a way to simulate or validate a batch in a “check” or “test” mode, without actually executing it in the S/4HANA backend, just to detect all potential errors?
  • Or is the recommended approach, as suggested by CAP documentation, to implement strong input validation before triggering the batch, to ensure that it will succeed?

Any insights, ideas, or shared experiences would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: PGI and PGR in Advanced Returns Management (ARM)
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I’m trying to better understand how PGI (Post Goods Issue) and PGR (Post Goods Receipt) entries work in Advanced Returns Management (ARM). Below is the scenario I’m testing:

Scenario 1: Standard OTC (MTO process)

  1. Sales Order – Created for MTO.

  2. Delivery – Inventory is posted against the sales order and line item, and PGI is executed.

  3. Billing – Invoice (F2) is generated.

Scenario 2: Advanced Returns Management

  1. Advanced Return Order – Created with reference to the invoice of the above MTO sales order.

  2. Delivery + PGR – Return delivery is created, PGR is posted, and inventory is received into blocked stock (to be scrapped). no credit memo because we will create Subsequent Delivery Free of Charge

Scenario 3: Subsequent Delivery Free of Charge (SD-FC)

  1. Subsequent Delivery Free of Charge Sales Order with requirement type KE (MTO) – Created from the advanced return order. 

  2. Delivery – Delivery is created for this order.

  3. PGI Issue – When I attempt to do PGI, the system does not allow PGI if I upload the inventory against the SD-FC sales order and line item (it shows no inventory available).

    • However, if I upload the inventory against the return sales order and line item, then PGI is allowed for the SD-FC delivery.

       

Question

Is this the expected system behavior in ARM?

In classic returns, when we create a subsequent delivery free of charge sales order with reference to the return order, the system usually allows PGI if stock is uploaded directly against the SD-FC sales order and line item.

But in ARM, it seems PGI only works if the stock is uploaded against the return sales order instead of the SD-FC sales order.

👉 Could someone clarify if this difference is by design in ARM or if I’m missing a configuration step?

entry.title: Hard currency values as realtime posting in asset depreciation area - Turkey POC
entry.content:
Dear sir/madam,

We have added hard currency as parallel currency for ledger postings

Local currency/Company code currency- USD

Global currency - USD

Hard Currency - TRY

we have created new chart of depreciation and created multiple depreciation areas for different ledger postings.

0L - Leading ledger

L1- Local ledger

T1- Tax ledger

For L1 ledger for asset postings, we want to have hard currency values as real time posting

So for ledger L1, we need system to take Hard currency valuess to be posted to GL instead of deriving from company code currency. is there any affect to other ledgers if we make hard currency values as real time posting. Please let us know.

 

Thanks

entry.title: Not able to pick the quantity in the delivery
entry.content:
I am unable to pick the quantity in the delivery. The item category is relevant for picking, and Warehouse Management (WM) is not active for this delivery.

Below is the process I followed:

  1. Created Sales Order with MTO.

  2. Created Delivery and performed PGI (inventory posted against the sales order and line item).

  3. Created Invoice.

  4. Created Return Order.

  5. Performed Delivery and PGR – stock was received against the return order and scrapped.

  6. Created Subsequent Delivery Free of Charge Order with reference to the return sales order (Requirement type KE, MTO order).

  7. Created Delivery – however, unable to pick the quantity in the delivery, even though stock is available.

entry.title: Background Jobs monitoring
entry.content:
Steps to Monitor backgrounds jobs in S/4HANA

Step 1: Login into your Source System S/4HANA

Step 2: Use T-code SM37 then you can see below snap

Step 3: Enter Job name or username which jobs need to monitor if you know Job name or username who created job.

Step 4: Once you are fine with job name or username then you need to proceed with job status need to select
job is schedule or Released or Ready or Active or Finished or Canceled. Select accordingly.

Step 5: Select date time or After event.
note: Mostly Date time only prefer

Step 6: Execute.
